text:
Hi everyone! :slightly_smiling_face: Can anyone help me out with my code? I am trying to find what Contact Names do I have repeated on my Contact database from a CSV file. I have already my code, but after testing it out with 4 contact names on my CSV (3 that are on my Contact List databse from HubSpot, and 1 that is not), my output is this image I am attaching:

"False" meaning that it is not on my Contact List database from HubSpot.

Can anyone help me?

My intention is to program a code while using my API Key, so from a CSV file (Column A - Contact Name), get which Contacts Name are on my Contact List database from HubSpot.

<@U01QVR44MEY> I have used the API you have provided me. Still the *options* array is receiving empty in the response.
It's happening when i have labels and internal values different.
Hi all. I'm new to HubSpot and I am reading through the API docs. Is there any way to use the API to retrieve data from a Standard HubSpot account instead of just the Developer account?

Hi! does anyone know what id property I should use when trying to read a batch of emails through the v3 api? :slightly_smiling_face: I've tried email_id, id and hs_record_id, but they all yield the same response (yes, the ids are valid)
 `[`
    `{`
      `"status": "error",`
      `"category": "OBJECT_NOT_FOUND",`
      `"message": "Could not get some EMAIL objects, they may be deleted or not exist. Check that ids are valid.",`
      `"context": {`
        `"ids": [`
          `"3008637232",`
          `"3950277112"`
        `]`
      `}`
    `}`
`]`
this is the API call I'm trying out:

`batch_read_input_simple_public_object_id = BatchReadInputSimplePublicObjectId(properties=["hs_timestamp,hs_email_direction"], properties_with_history=["hs_timestamp"], id_property="email_id", inputs=[{"id":"3008637232"},{"id":"3950277112"}])`
`try:`
    `api_response = client.crm.objects.emails.batch_api.read(batch_read_input_simple_public_object_id=batch_read_input_simple_public_object_id, archived=False)`
    `pprint(api_response)`

Hey everyone :wave: we are building a sales tool that works as an extension to a CRM like HubSpot. We need to build an API and I wanted to get a better understanding how to do that. Ideally we would like to speak to someone (maybe from the HubSpot team?) to understand that better.

Would love to get some feedback and hear from you!

Best,
Freddy

I am having this *error* when trying to fetch *contact lists*

<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/lists/{list_id}/contacts/all>

We are testing in *paid account* and works when the *developer app* is not in the same account.

I believe there is some kind of *bug* in the API, because if the developer app is at the same account as the paid account this error arise, no matter u are integrating with a paid account or not.
Are you sure your private app have the required scopes?
100% sure
it is working on developer app in another account with same scopes, same redirect url, same everything
the only thing that is different is that one is in the same account as the paid account and the other (that is working) is in a separated account
so when I switch the client id and client secret between apps, it works in one scenario and not work in the other
Hi everyone is there any way to create a new conversation using api , in docs we can search , message a thread like there but i couln't find to start a new conversation
I will for now need to create a new account just to use this endpoint, but would be good to be investigated, that is why I am reporting this issue here
That's what the majority of the api does (standard accounts) there are just a couple of endpoints for interacting with dev accounts (crm cards, custom workflow actions, 1 or 2 more)
Which endpoint are you trying to use?
You can leave that idProperty blank, that's just if you want to read the email using a different unique id
For example you would use that idProperty with the companies endpoint if you wanted to find companies using their domain property instead of object_id
Are you talking about extending parts of the CRM? and if so which parts? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/extensions/custom-cards>
CRM cards are kinda the defacto way of extending the CRM currently, maybe you can shrae more about what you're trying to do
Honestly the easiest way would just to send an email to the HubSpot email address

We are basically building a sales room (with a mutual action plan) that sales people (AE’s) use to collaborate with buyers, which is an extension to the CRM.

The touchpoints in our solution should be synced with HubSpot so that HubSpot still functions as the single source of truth for the touch points tracked with a buyer.

This goes a little deeper overall, but this is pretty much what needs to happen.

Hi everyone o/

I developed two integrations with HubSpot:
• one is triggered when a new contact is created
• the other one is triggered when a selected form receives a new submission. 
when the form receives a new submission, a new contact is created on HubSpot’s interface.
but it is not shooting the *new contact trigger.* 

is this the expected behavior?
from what I think, both triggers should be activated in this scenario…
Not really, if a contact submits a form with an email already in the crm, the corresponding contact will be updated (it's impossible to have 2 contacts with the same email)
But where would you like the physical (virtual hahaha) extension point to sit on the page (if any)?

Hey everyone, I would like to know how can I retrieve a line item (product) and connect with the deals in the API. Because at the moment I can only retrieve them separately and I need to know which products are in each deal.
So basically what you're trying to do is getting every product (line-item) associated to a deal?
Yes
do you need to know anything but the product name/sku?
like amount or price?
Yes
what do you need to know?

I can create separate tables (products and deals) and merge them, but in case there is a discount that is applicable to only this one line item and not to the product, I would like to obtain this information
so you want: name, sku, number of products, and price
and other custom fields
sounds good, I'm creating a little search request for you one moment
<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/line_items/search>
This will pull in all the line items for a certain deal, (currently 123) but you can change that
I get an error when I try to click at the url
POST request
what's the error?

HTTP ERROR 405
Reason:
```    Method Not Allowed```
Are you sending it as a POST request?
did that work?
checking if I can also see this behavior now
I also notice that's it's doing the same thing for me, you might need to use the owners api for this. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>

you'll just change your endpoint just a little:
```<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/owners>```
that will pull over the ids and names for each owner

in our tool it could look like this:

• Creation of the project in our tool will allow a user to connect to a HubSpot deal for example
• And then this field will possibly be visible in various places in the product
-> The synced information back to HubSpot will then be relatd to that project in the deal
oh so you don't need to show the ui of your tool in HubSpot at all
well not sure how that would work but if there is a way, then we would want to do that as well.
maybe we can schedule a call with our cto and we can do a little brainstorm to explain the details of it?
would be very helpful for us!
sure we could definitely do that, my calendar link is <http://HubSpot.com/meetings/carter-mckay|HubSpot.com/meetings/carter-mckay>
sweet
will set sth up
sounds good

this seems odd… I accidentally submitted two times with the same email, but changing the other fields values, and a new contact was created.

and I also found out that the contacts created through form submissions have a `createdate`  that are 8 days apart, for example:
contact createdate: 2023-02-06 18:16
form submission: 2023-02-14 17:51

Likely means the contact existed before the form submission. You can confirm this either by checking the Contact Record > Actions (left side) > View Property History > go to the first page.. you should see what the source of the record creation. You can also look at View All Properties > search for Createdate > hover over the createdate property > Details.. this also shows you sources of property changes for specific properties

Hello everyone, I wondering whether I can set contacts as non-marketing via nodejs sdk HubSpot. I have researched around about this problem and see that I cannot set contacts as non-marketing via api. So do I have any solutions for this? Thank you so much
